file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-00-06-02 - CONFIG-2 - PASSENGER CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES SAFETY PIN - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES SAFETY PIN - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to install and remove the passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pins. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH POST-MOD SB 52-00-06-910-801-A SAFETY PINS - INSTALLATION AND RE- 145-52-0040 MOVAL EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 52-00-06 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-00-06-910-801-A EFFECTIVITY: POST-MOD SB 145-52-0040 2. PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH SAFETY PINS - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL A. General (1) This task is only applicable to POST-MOD SB145-52-0040 aircraft. (2) The passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pins must be installed when the aircraft is parked or towed and during maintenance procedures. (3) When not in use, the passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pins are kept in a recess in the aft console, behind the pilot seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SB145-52-0040 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 812 Passenger cabin - LH 822 Passenger cabin - RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE LH and RH passenger-cabin escape 1 Does the task hatches I. Installation (Figure 201) SUBTASK 420-005-A WARNING: DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH SAFETY PINS, PREVENT SUDDEN AND STRONG MOVEMENTS OF THE HANDLES. THIS CAN CAUSE AN ACCIDENTAL UNLOCKING OF THE PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES, AND INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT CAN OCCUR. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 910-801-A/200 CONFIG-2 52-00-06 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Open the access panel. (2) Make sure that the passenger-cabin escape-hatch handles are in the LOCK position. (3) Install the passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pin through the stop pin and the support in each passenger-cabin escape hatch. (4) Make sure that the red REMOVE BEFORE FLIGHT streamer is clearly in view. J. Removal (Figure 201) SUBTASK 020-005-A (1) Make sure that the passenger-cabin escape-hatch handles are in the LOCK position. (2) Remove the passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pins. (3) Close the access panel. (4) Keep the passenger-cabin escape-hatch safety pins in the recess in the aft console, behind the pilot seat. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 910-801-A/200 CONFIG-2 52-00-06 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
